intro: Myrsine leucantha, commonly known as the white myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale green flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It typically grows as an understory shrub in moist, shaded forest environments. Myrsine leucantha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
